channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Netflix co-CEO reveals Harry and Meghan 'shopped' themselves around to 'all major companies'
item.description: Hastings, 59, who is the co-founder and co-CEO of the streaming giant, was on CNBC on Wednesday morning, when he discussed Harry and Meghan's deal.

item.title: Social media users mock Boris Johnson's army of 'Covid marshals'
item.description: From Monday it will be illegal to assemble in groups of seven or more and the PM announced specific workers will be introduced to help ensure social distancing in town and city centres.

item.title: Moment woman climbs underneath ScotRail train after dropping her SHOPPING off the platform
item.description: The traveller had been boarding a train at Troon station inÂ Ayrshire on Tuesday when items appeared to drop from a bag onto the tracks beneath the locomotive.

item.title: Lily Allen stuns in a 60s-inspired Dior dress as she marries Stranger Things star David Harbour
item.description: The singer, 35, and the actor, 45, married at the famed Graceland Wedding Chapel on Monday after obtaining a marriage licence to wed in Sin City.

item.title: Corona slammed for advert showing trippers in Outer Hebrides which is already besieged by tourists
item.description: Beer brand Corona has been slammed for adverts showing staycationers enjoying 'lager, 4x4s and wild arson' in an area of Scotland where locals say they have been besieged by tourists.

item.title: Birmingham faces looming lockdown, West Midlands mayor admits
item.description: West Midlands mayor Andy Street said even tougher restrictions were 'looking likely' now Birmingham's case rate had jumped to 69 per 100,000, up from 30 a week ago.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Boris Johnson unveils draconian new curbs
item.description: Addressing the nation at a No10 press conference, Boris johnson said the spike in infections seen over the past week left him no choice but to tighten lockdown across England.

item.title: Dramatic moment hundreds of police officers raid traveller site in 3am
item.description: Hundreds of armed officers tore into the traveller site at 3am today in Orpington, south-east London, in what is believed to be one of Britain's biggest ever suspected gun stings.

item.title: A 29- year old has been arrested after the body of a man was discovered in bushes
item.description: A man has been arrested after a body was found in bushes near motorway footbridge. Police were called at the scene, near M621 in Leeds, West Yorks

item.title: UK announces 2,659 more coronavirus cases and eight deaths
item.description: Addressing the nation at a No10, Boris Johnson said the spike in infections seen over the past week left him no choice but to tighten lockdown across England for the first time since March.

item.title: E-cigarettes 'CAN worsen heart and lung conditions and must not be considered harmless'
item.description: A report ordered by the Department of Health in the UK found that vaping, which is touted as a healthier alternative to smoking, would be a harmful choice unless replacing cigarettes.

item.title: Incredible pictures show baby and children passed to safety after their boat almost sank
item.description: A brave father was praised for his quick-thinking actions as he protected his family, which included a baby, from danger when their 24ft vessel started to sink off the coast of Devon.

item.title: Prince William makes surprise visit to Belfast to meet with frontline responders
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge, 38, opened up about his mental health struggle while working as an ambulance pilot during a surprise visit to Belfast to meet with frontline workers and first responders.

item.title: Passing out drunk could more than DOUBLE your risk of later developing dementia
item.description: Researchers looked at more thanÂ 130,000 adults in Europe. Losing consciousness from drinking, regardless of the amount of alcohol consumed, raised the odds of dementia.

item.title: Donald Trump called the coronavirus 'deadly stuff' in recorded Bob Woodward interviews in February
item.description: Bob Woodward's new bombshell book reveals President Trump calling the coronavirus 'deadly stuff' on the same day he predicted the virus would become weaker and 'then gone.'

item.title: Game of Thrones author George R.R. Martin wants to build fantasy castle in his backyard
item.description: Game of Thrones author George R.R. Martin wants to build a real-life 'castle' in his backyard in Santa Fe, New Mexico. He submitted plans for a fortress-like building with a 27ft tower.

item.title: The Walking Dead to end after season 11... but there are two more spinoffs in the works at AMC
item.description: After more than 10 years on the air, AMC's hugely popular show The Walking Dead will end after season 11, it has been confirmed.

item.title: Julian Assange is being persecuted by Donald Trump to get back at Barack Obama, court hears
item.description: Assange, 49, is wanted in the US for allegedly conspiring with army intelligence analyst Chelsea Manning to expose military secrets between January and May 2010.

item.title: Oscars set widespread new diversity and inclusion initiatives that will go into effect in 2024
item.description: The US film academy's shake-up means films hoping to win the top prize will have to hire more black, female, LGBT or disabled cast and crew or address themes that affect those communities.

item.title: Pictured: Husband of teacher accused of having sex with schoolboy
item.description: Kandice Barber, of Buckinghamshire, is accused of meeting up for sex with a schoolboy, then 15, three times in late 2018. She denies the charges. The trial continues.

item.title: Last post of Iraq War veteran who shot himself dead on a Facebook Live
item.description: Shortly before ending his life on Facebook Life, Army veteran Ronnie McNutt, 31, from Mississippi, shared an inspirational quote about letting people know they are loved.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 'Moonshot' testing plans to test millions per day
item.description: Theatres and sports venues could soon test all audience members and let in those with a negative result under Boris Johnson's plans to get life in the UK back to normal.

item.title: Chief scientist Sir Patrick Vallance dashes hopes of coronavirus vaccine in 2020
item.description: Sir Patrick Vallance said the vaccine may be at least four months away during a Downing Street press briefing. It comes after trials of the Oxford vaccine were put on hold.

item.title: Snot amused! Pet called Poptart has a hilarious rapid-fire sneezing fit
item.description: Poptart, a five-year-old rescue cat from Selinsgrove, Pennsylvania, launched into a sneezing fit after sniffing her owner Zach's Dale's lunch.

item.title: Russia warns Germany will be guilty of 'provocation' if it fails to share Alexei Navalny's records
item.description: Russia issued a strong protest earlier today over the alleged poisoning of the opposition figure after it denounced what it said were baseless claims and warned of a major risk to diplomatic ties.

item.title: Silvio Berlusconi, 83, reveals he is fighting a 'hellish' case of coronavirus
item.description: The 83-year-old Berlusconi,Â who was admitted to Milan's San Raffaele hospital last week, made the comments during a phone call toÂ a candidate from his Forza Italia party.

item.title: Elon Musk loses record $16.3 billion in just ONE DAY amid rout in US technology stocks
item.description: Elon Musk's (pictured) $16.3 billion drop in net worth is the largest single-day wipe-out in the history of Bloomberg's Billionaire index, and comes amid a route in American technology stocks.

item.title: Grandfather, 84, who had NEVER left UK is the earliest known fatality from coronavirus outside China
item.description: The death of Peter Attwood, 84, from Chatham, Kent, has raised new questions about an alleged Chinese cover-up of the origins of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Fury as FIRE ENGINE gets stuck in new cycle lane put in as part of Covid-friendly traffic measures
item.description: The video shows the blue-lit emergency vehicle wedged between a wooden planter and a parked white car in Ferndale, south London.

item.title: Terrorist who Manchester bomber visited in UK prison is refusing to help public inquiryÂ
item.description: Abdalraouf Abdallah, 26, is declining to speak to lawyers for the inquiry who want to know about his links to the Arena suicide bomber Salman Abedi, the hearing in Manchester was told today.

item.title: Pictured: Stab victim who survived Birmingham knife rampage
item.description: Teacher Rhys Cummings, 24, was among those injured in the attack alongside his friend Shane Rowley. The pair had been out in Birmingham ahead of the rampage.

item.title: Government launches task force to REOPEN Hammersmith Bridge after it closed to traffic in April 2019
item.description: A Government task force has been launched to reopen Hammersmith Bridge as 'speedily as possible' after its initial closure in April 2019, Transport Secretary Grant Shapps announced.

item.title: Shamed England star Mason Greenwood held SIX rowdy house parties during Covid lockdown
item.description: The England striker held raucous get-togethers at the property, which sleeps 13 people, in Manchester, after it was advertised on Airbnb and Booking.com. The music kept residents up all night, they claimed.

item.title: These are the electric cars with the longest quoted ranges
item.description: Today marks World EV Day, which is being used by the car industry and rule makers to announce new measures and campaigns to promote electric cars. But which EVs can go the furthest?

item.title: China's ambassador to the UK is caught 'liking' explicit porn clip on Twitter
item.description: The 10-second footage, which appeared on the ambassador's 'likes' feed, shows a woman performing a sex act on a man using her feet. The Chinese Embassy said the account had been hacked.

item.title: Bollywood actress Rhea Chakraborty is arrested
item.description: Rhea Chakraborty was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly buying drugs for her former boyfriend, the actor Sushant Singh Rajput, whose suicide sparked a media storm in India.

item.title: Google starts rolling out Android 11 update including privacy controls
item.description: The updated operating system offers users more control over their privacy settings, such as the ability to grant single use access, not permanent, to apps.

item.title: Lloyds Bank to cut 865 jobs as it revives restructuring plans made before CovidÂ
item.description: Lloyds Bank plans to shed 865 jobs as it works to simplify the business after putting plans on hold for several months due to Covid-19. The jobs will affect insurance, wealth and retail teams.

item.title: Charlie Hebdo survivor says gunmen shouted 'Allahu akbar' before shooting him with Kalashnikov
item.description: Laurent Sourisseau, known as 'Riss' and who was himself badly wounded in the shoulder in the Paris attack, said on Wednesday he stands by the controversial editorial decision.

item.title: Fire destroys Greece's largest refugee camp
item.description: A fire which broke out inside Moria, the largest refugee camp on the Greek island of Lesbos, on Wednesday was started by migrants with Covid who refused to isolate.

item.title: Ministers DEFEND breaching international law over Brexit divorce deal
item.description: Boris Johnson is facing a furious Tory mutiny amid claims he is trashing the UK's moral authority by reneging on the Withdrawal Agreement, only signed in January.

item.title: Ex-Radio 4 boss says BBC stars' use of social media to express political views was 'out of control'
item.description: Former Radio 4 boss Mark Damazer said BBC presenters' use of social media had grown 'out of control'. Mr Damazer said the BBC is 'trying to navigate a complicated country'.

item.title: Xbox Series X and Series S will both launch on November 10, Microsoft confirms
item.description: The devices will also be made available through its Xbox All Access programme, allowing players to split the cost across 24 months from Â£20.99 a month.

item.title: Windsor Castle workers demand 'loyalty' as up to HALF of Queen's household staff are facing the axe
item.description: Up to half of the Royal Collection Trust's 600 royal staff could be axed while remaining workers are facing pension cutsÂ after Covid-19 created an Â£18 million black hole in Her Majesty's finances.

item.title: Back home! 80-year-old hiker who went missing for four days is reunited with his 'angry' wife
item.description: Pensioner Harry Harvey, described as a 'competent hiker', was reported missing in the Gunnerside area of Richmondshire, North Yorkshire, at around 1.30pm on Sunday.

item.title: Viking board game pieces found by metal detector go up for auction
item.description: Retired miner Mick Bott, 73, made the find at a site in Torksey, Lincolnshire, where the Vikings formed a winter camp in AD 872.

item.title: Remains of a 2,000-year-old Roman roundhouse unearthed at Bamburgh Castle
item.description: The remnants of the building indicate it could be up to 65 feet (20 metres) in diameter and likely belonged to a member of society of relative importance.

item.title: Fossilised APE tooth unearthed in India belongs to the gibbon ancestor
item.description: Experts from Arizona State University worked with Christopher C Gilbert of Hunter College who discovered the tooth in 2015 to uncover its place in the tree of life.

item.title: Police officer filmed holding assault suspect in headlock is under criminal investigation
item.description: Shocking footage shows an officer pushingÂ Hassan Ahmed, 27, up against a car in Halifax, West Yorkshire on August 16. The officer appears to shout: 'Chill out or I'll choke you out.'

item.title: Tycoon Manoli Olympitis, 71, charts a lifetime of high jinks in new memoir
item.description: London-born Emmanuel Olympitis, known asÂ 'Manoli', 71, spills the beans on a lifetime spent frequenting the world's glitziest venues - and gambling at poker - in his memoir, Marked Cards.

item.title: China 'finds' five Indians who were 'kidnapped' by its soldiers on the disputed Himalayan border
item.description: The Indian Army said it had spoken with its counterparts in the People's Liberation Army who confirmed that the youths from Arunachal Pradesh were discovered on their side of the frontier.

item.title: Fears new lockdown rules may be a setback for call to return to the office
item.description: Boris Johnson's draconian new coronavirus restrictions have delivered yet another gut-punch to businesses across the country today, who fear they 'will never return to normal'.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: My sincere, heartfelt 10-point tribute to the Kardashians
item.description: They're finally throwing in the towel on the world's worst show, an unctuous orgy of dumb-ass douchebaggery that follows the talentless lives of the most shameless family in America.

item.title: Michael Cohen recounts in book how Trump wouldn't name Apprentice contestant the winner
item.description: Donald Trump refused to let Kwame Jackson win the first season of The Apprentice because he was a 'black f**', Michael Cohen claims in book Disloyal.

item.title: PICTURED: Tiger King's Joe Exotic prison injuries after he says he was 'sexually assaulted by guard'
item.description: Joe Exotic has written to Donald Trump asking the president to pardon him. In an email he claimed: 'I was tied in a chair (for) so long the skin came off my arms

item.title: Boy accused of shooting a 15-year-old appears in court charged with possessing double-barrel shotgun
item.description: Police were called to reports that a teenager had been shot on the Grange Farm housing estate in Kesgrave, Suffolk, at around 8.40am on Monday.

item.title: Belarus opposition politician snatched by masked men as Lukashenko's ruthless crackdown continues
item.description: Maxim Znak was of the last remaining members of the country's opposition Coordination Council still at large until he was taken from his office by masked people wearing plain clothes, his allies claim.

item.title: The hidden plastics in your teabags: Twinings, Tetley and Yorkshire Tea all fail experiment
item.description: Tests at the University of East Anglia, which featured on BBC show War on Plastic revealed thatÂ Twinings, Tetley and Yorkshire Tea bags contain the plasticÂ polypropylene.

item.title: John Lewis releases 'trendy' capsule range in a bid to attract 'woke' shoppers
item.description: John Lewis has released a 'trendy' capsule collection called the Style With Purpose campaign, with stylist Rochelle White saying it could be a bid to attract 'woke' shoppers to the British retailer.

item.title: Donald Trump is nominated for the 2021 Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: President Trump (pictured) has been nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize by Christian Tybring-Gjedde, a member of the Norwegian Parliament, for his efforts towards resolving conflicts.

item.title: Pope Francis removes his mask as he touches worshippers and vows to defeat coronavirus with love
item.description: The Pope, 83, removed his mask when he arrived at San Damaso, he smiled and chatted, shook hands and touched the foreheads of congregants who crowded close together at the barriers.

item.title: St Leger Festival to take place behind closed doors for next three days
item.description: The rest of St Leger Festival will be held behind closed doors, health bosses have announced. Around 3,500 people turned up to Doncaster Racecourse today for the pilot event.

item.title: More than 125,000 retail jobs have been axed and nearly 14,000 shops have closed so far this year
item.description: According to analysis by the Centre for Retail Research, 125,515 retail jobs have been axed and 13,867 shops have permanently shut across UK high streets, shopping centres and retail parks.

item.title: Finding Freedom author films with Netflix after Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's $150million dealÂ
item.description: Finding Freedom author Omid Scobie has revealed he is filming with Netflix days after the Duke, 35, and Duchess of Sussex, 39, signed a $150million megadeal with the US media giant.

item.title: Ex-nursery assistant who sat on 16-month-old twins to make extra cash avoids jail
item.description: McFee, of Barry, Angus, pleaded guilty in October 2019 to assaulting the twins, a boy and a girl, who cannot be identified, to the danger of their lives, at a house in Arbroath, also Angus, in June 2018.

item.title: Mother, 68, was stabbed to death by her reclusive alcoholic son, 44, at their home
item.description: Janice Woolford, 68, was stabbed eight times - mostly in the head and neck - by her reclusive alcoholic son Michael, 44, in Tunstall, Sunderland, in February.

item.title: Nazanin is being illegally held 'hostage' by Iran and is an emotional wreck, husband says
item.description: Mrs Zaghari-Ratcliffe, 42, was returned to court on Tuesday only months from her expected release date and told she would face a second trial in Tehran.

item.title: Man accuses Meryl Streep's nephew of racism after road rage 'attack'
item.description: David Peralta, 18, was hospitalized with severe head trauma and needed emergency surgery after the altercation with Charles Harrison Streep, 31, back on August 24.

item.title: Murder investigation after woman, 66, was found dead in Â£1.6m mock-Georgian homeÂ
item.description: Police were called at around 9.15pm on Tuesday after the unnamed woman was found collapsed in Bexley village, south east London.

item.title: Agora reveals its shortlisted images from a worldwide travel photography contestÂ Â
item.description: The stunning pictures were all shortlisted in Agora's #Travel2020 contest, which received 13,685 entries. Here MailOnline Travel presents its pick of the 50 shortlisted images.

item.title: Boris Johnson wants everybody in UK to be able to take coronavirus test everyday
item.description: Boris Johnson today said he wants everybody in the UK to be able to take a daily coronavirus test in order to get life back to normal.

item.title: Are these the world's WORST fashion fails?
item.description: People from across the globe have shared some of the most amusing fashion fails they've come across. The amusing images have been collated in an online gallery by Bored Panda.

item.title: Joss Stone is branded 'delusional' after saying she would great the Taliban leader 'with love'
item.description: Joss Stone, 33, from Devon, has been branded 'naive' after revealing she would greet Taliban leaderÂ Hibatullah Akhundzada with love, while speaking on her podcast A Cuppa Happy.

item.title: Beauty queen and cousin who spent night with Greenwood and Foden insist they paid for two rooms
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Model Nadia Sif Lindal Gunnarsdottir, 20, and her cousin Lara Clausen, 19, booked two rooms at the Saga Radisson Blu hotel, in Reykjavik, to meet the stars after their match.

item.title: Blackmailer is jailed for threatening to reveal professional's secret life as a prostitute
item.description: John Menzie,Â of Dundee, admitted trying to extort Â£10,000 from a woman, known as JE, by threatening to expose her secret past as an escort in Dundee and Perthshire.

item.title: EasyJet pilot orders passenger with chronic asthma to wear a mask or be thrown off flight
item.description: Nick, who spoke under partial anonymity, was confronted by the plane's pilot and told he would have to don a face covering during the hour-long flight from Jersey to Gatwick.

item.title: Duchess of Cornwall in high spirits as she pets pooches during visit to charity
item.description: The Duchess of Cornwall wore a visor in public for the first time today as she paid a visit to a Medical Detection Dogs training centre in Milton Keynes.

item.title: Inventor convicted of murdering a Swedish reporter claims she was blown up
item.description: Peter Madsen, a 49-year-old Danish inventor serving life for the murder of journalist Kim Wall, claimed she was blown up with a landmine as he spoke about the day she died for the first time.

item.title: Taiwan reports multiple Chinese fighters to its southwest
item.description: Taiwan's Defence Ministry said the Chinese Su-30 and J-10 fighters had entered Taiwan's 'response zone' to its southwest on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Keeping up with the faces! How Kim, Khloe, Kylie and the rest have changed since season one
item.description: Though it's undeniable that styles - and budgets - have changed since the start, many think the ladies have had a little extra help throughout the years.

item.title: The new rules football fans face in Scotland as crowds return this weekend
item.description: There is an exhaustive list of new rules football fans in Scotland must abide by this weekend as crowds return.Â Two pilot games are allowing 300 supporters into the ground to watch.

item.title: Racist pensioner beaten up on a London bus by two black passengers after calling them 'monkeys'
item.description: In the footage, filmed in Edgware, north London yesterday, the pensioner is accused of calling the black passengers 'monkeys' to which he replies: 'Yes you're a monkey'.

item.title: Cancer sufferer, 31, talks openly about facing death
item.description: Elliot Dallen, 31, living in London, was diagnosed with a rare adrenal cancer in 2018. After two years of treatment including a drugs trial, Dallen has described his feelings as he faces his final weeks.

item.title: Thousands of Barclays and Barclaycard customers unable to access money on mobile apps
item.description: Barclays and Barclaycard mobile apps crashed today, leading to thousands of complaints flooding in from customers who were unable to access their money on either of the apps.

item.title: Book reveals how horror film obsessed cinema owner became a serial killer
item.description: A book reveals how a cinema owner obsessed with the Friday The 13th horror films became one of Britain's most notorious serial killers. Peter Moore was convicted for murdering four people

item.title: A mum says she can only eat mashed food after surgery to remove her teeth
item.description: A lactose intolerant mother from Anlaby, East Yorks, says that a surgery to remove her teeth has left her unable to eat anything but soup, mashed potato and baby food

item.title: Pound sinks to six-week low as fears mount over collapse of Brexit trade talks
item.description: Sterling has slumped to its lowest level against the US dollar since July, hitting a value of just under 1.29.

item.title: Grandmother, 86, is brutally raped and beaten by attacker, 33, in India
item.description: The woman told her attacker she was 'like his grandmother' in a bid to stop the assault after he lured her from her home in Delhi on Monday evening.

item.title: RWCMD musician, 25, raped woman when she fell asleep, court hears
item.description: Benjamin Williams-Stacey, 25, is accused of 'taking advantage' of the young woman after she fell asleep while getting drunk at a student party, Cardiff Crown Court heard.

item.title: From a sex tape to rich lists: How the Kardashians turned reality show into an money-spinning empire
item.description: The TV series made global stars of the Kardashian girls - Kim, her sisters Kourtney and Khloe, and her half-sisters Kendall and Kylie Jenner. They then found ways to use that fame to cash in.

item.title: Michael Cohen says 'mob boss' Trump is behind leak of his conversation with Chris CuomoÂ
item.description: Cohen claimed the recordings played by Tucker Carlson were given to the Fox News host by the Trump Organization and the president's son Donald Jr.

item.title: Panda develops bald patches due to rolling around in its enclosure
item.description: Footage shows the three-year-old male panda Fuxing walking in his enclosure with bald patches on his head. The zoo said the bear rolled around 'frequently', which caused the hair loss.

item.title: Businesses closed by local lockdowns to receive Â£1,500 grants
item.description: Businesses in England which are forced to close as a result of a local lockdown will now be able to claim a Â£1,500 survival payment from the Treasury.

item.title: Could face masks build IMMUNITY to Covid-19? Scientists theorise
item.description: The unproven theory was detailed by scientists from the University of California in an editorial in the New England Journal of Medicine. It may partly explain why fewer people are dying from Covid.

item.title: KUWTK: Why are the Kardashians stopping the show after 14 years?
item.description: Now the family have finally decided to call it quits on the show with no public reason behind their decision, other than it is 'time' to say goodbye, we take a look at the reasons behind its departure.

item.title: Rare 'Ugly Duckling' ginger seal pup may have to be rescued by biologists
item.description: An exceptionally rare ginger fur seal pup has been spotted in the Sea of Okhotsk in Russia.

item.title: It's the mini Kardashian-Jenners! Family have welcomed 10 new additions over 14 years of KUWTK
item.description: Over the course of 14 years, the hit E! show has welcomedÂ ten new additions in the form of mini Kardashian-Jenners who will no doubt take over the family dynasty one day.

item.title: It's the mini Kardashian-Jenners! Family have welcomed 10 new additions over 14 years of KUWTK
item.description: Over the course of 14 years, the hit E! show has welcomedÂ ten new additions in the form of mini Kardashian-Jenners who will no doubt take over the family dynasty one day.

item.title: Bus driver shows off skills as he backs people-carrier into VERY tight space overhanging a ditch
item.description: Bus driver PJ Biju expertly manoeuvres a white Toyota Innova into a dangerously tight parking space in Kerala, India. During the attempt, the rear wheels come within inches of a sharp drop.

item.title: Sky News star Jacquie Beltrao celebrates final chemo sessionÂ
item.description: British presenter Jacquie, who revealed in June that she was facing cancer again, told her social media followers that she felt nervous about stopping chemotherapy.

item.title: AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine trials put on hold after suspected 'serious' reaction
item.description: On Tuesday, trials of thee COVID-19 vaccine being developed by Oxford University and AstraZeneca have been placed on a hold after a suspected dangerously bad reaction to the shot.

item.title: Jessica Mulroney 'deletes' her Instagram posts because of 'bullying'
item.description: Jessica Mulroney, 40, from Toronto, took to Instagram and explained that she deletes some of her Instagram posts because of 'bullying and hatred.'

item.title: 'Hands, face, space': Department of Health launches campaign pushing basic coronavirus messages
item.description: It comes as part of the Government's latest 'Hands, Face, Space' campaign which attempts to drill basic Covid messaging to the masses in time for winter, when cases are expected to rise.

item.title: ITV's Love Your Garden faces 'most difficult' challenge yet to help quadruple amputee
item.description: Viewers watching the moment Chris Garlick, from Pontypool, Wales, and wife Karran opened their eyes on their stunning new garden said they were in Chris almost lost his life to sepsis in 2017.

item.title: Coronavirus: BA passengers 'refused cash refunds' for cancellations
item.description: Gordon and Margaret Minto, fromÂ South Shields, said they emailed the airline asking for Â£4,748 back after their US trip was cancelled. The airline told them that they had already accepted vouchers.

item.title: Brexit: Road haulage chiefs warn of 80 per cent chance of 'chaos in Kent'
item.description: Richard Burnett, chief executive of the Road Haulage Association, told MPs that ministers are in 'denial' about the prospect of a border meltdown as lorry drivers are forced to adapt to new paperwork.

item.title: Forty-five known exoplanets possess an Earth-like atmosphere
item.description: Experts fromÂ LuleÃ¥ University of Technology, Sweden, created a new way to determine the habitability of these distant worlds by studying their atmosphere.

item.title: 'Naughty Tory' MP Charlie Elphicke's matrimonial home goes up for sale for Â£1.4m
item.description: The disgraced Conservative has listed his Â£1.4million property in Dover, Kent, for sale following his stunning three-week trial and conviction on July 30.

item.title: Sunken remains of a 400-year-old Dutch Empire ship found in Baltic Sea
item.description: Divers discovered the wreck at the mouth of the Gulf of Finland, where they believe the low salinity and lack of sunlight in the water helped protect the ship's structure.

item.title: Extreme staycation: Renegade Motel by Jeep is a tent fixed to The O2 hanging 250ft above the ground
item.description: The Motel, an innovative hanging tent system known as a portaledge, offers money-can't-buy views of the London skyline. A rain cover and 'very warm sleeping bags' are supplied.

item.title: Dominatrix barred from Lake District gastropub is dog-loving 30-year-old
item.description: The dominatrix who was barred from The Mill in Ulverston, Cumbria, for spanking her 'slave' on Sunday has been revealed to be dog-loving Lydia Chadwick, 30.

item.title: Woman who almost received labiaplasty launches a crusade to photograph other women's private parts
item.description: Photographer Ellie Eggwick, from Queensland's Sunshine Coast, was inspired toÂ capture 500 women's vaginas after tackling her own insecurities.

item.title: Assassin is found guilty of double murder after shooting dead mother-of-nine, 53, and her nephew
item.description: Obina Ezeoke, 28, has been found guilty of murdering an aunt and her nephew after an unprecedented five successive trials at the Old Bailey.

item.title: Thai man is bitten on the penis by a python while sitting on the toilet
item.description: Siraphop Masukarat, 18, went to the loo on Tuesday evening at his home in Nonthaburi, central Thailand when he felt a sudden searing pain in his manhood.

item.title: Animal lover's simple hack stops hedgehogs falling down her garden steps
item.description: Agata Majcher, 38, from Edinburgh, Scotland, filmed footage of a hedgehog successfully climbing to the top of her garden steps with the aid of discarded bricks laid out in between the steps.

item.title: Call the Cops viewers are left 'heartbroken' as a 999 operator receives a call from a suicidal man
item.description: In last night's episode of Call the Cops, 999 operators received a call from a 20-year-old man, known only as Danny, from Cornwall, who threatened to end his life.

item.title: Newborn baby is found abandoned with a rusty knife sticking out of her back in Argentina
item.description: The injured infant was found by a passerby on Costanera Oeste Avenue in the city of Posadas in the north-eastern Argentine province of Misiones.

item.title: White woman pulls a gun on black activists in South Africa
item.description: A 52-year-old woman was being escorted out of a mall in South Africa after clashing with far-left protesters demanding the closure of a pharmacy chain when she suddenly pulled a gun on them.

item.title: Mother sparks rush-hour chaos after 'getting off train and leaving her baby behind'
item.description: The woman was parted from her child, who a commuter said was in a pram, at around 5pm yesterday. The pair were reunited after the mother pick up her baby at the following stop, Nunhead.

item.title: Black and white images from the Civil Rights Movement in 1963 brought to color for the first time
item.description: British author Jordan J. Lloyd has colorized a collection of previously black and white images which depict some of the most significant events during the Civil Rights Movement.

item.title: Pizza Hut will shut 29 of its 240 restaurants with up to 450 jobs at riskÂ
item.description: Pizza Hut said itÂ faced 'significant disruption' from the coronavirus pandemic and the affect of lockdown was so detrimental that 'sales are not expected to fully bounce back until well into 2021'.

item.title: Sales for e-bikes and scooters have tripled as Brits avoid public transport
item.description: A car and motoring company has tripled its sales of e-bikes and scooters since last year as the coronavirus pandemic has made Brits wanting to avoid public transport

item.title: Greek islands of Santorini, Serifos and Tinos added to Wales's quarantine list
item.description: Holidaymakers travelling to Wales from Santorini, Serifos and Tinos must now self-isolate for 14 days after they touch down back home from 4am on Wednesday.

item.title: Outbreaks of infections including Covid-19 in England's care homes at lowest levels for six MONTHS
item.description: Between August 24 and August 30 there were 58 outbreaks or 'acute respiratory infections' recorded in England's care homes, a 38 per cent fall on last week's 94 cases.

item.title: Hunky ice cream entrepreneur leaves Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? viewers hot under the collar
item.description: Scott Burgess, 25, from Devon, left Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? viewers hot under the collar last night. The contestant raced through the first 10 questions on the programme.

item.title: Tracey Cox reveals what your go-to sex position says about your relationshipÂ
item.description: Tracey Cox says the average couple alternates between just two or three of the 600 positions for intercourse. British sex expert reveals what your choice of position reveals about your relationship.

item.title: Japanese artist gives funerals for sex dolls and lets customers live out fantasies as murder victims
item.description: Leiya Arata, who is in her thirties, holds funerals for sex dolls, encourages people to dress up as murder victims for photo shoots and turns people into love dolls at her studio in Osaka.

item.title: Woman speaks of 12-year fight to become a mother which has seen her spend Â£30,000 on IVF
item.description: Jade and Andrew Barton, from Basingstoke, Hampshire, have spent more than Â£30,000 on IVF in their efforts to conceive, including borrowing Â£12,000 from friends and family.

item.title: Chef left schoolgirl suicidal when he pressured her into having sex
item.description: A mother of a schoolgirl who was left suicidal after chef Jack Cross pressured her into having sex has branded the Â£700 fine he was handed 'an insult'. He admitted begging for sex at Warwick Crown Court.

item.title: Dad outsmarts his daughter when she challenges him to pull a $5 bill from under a bottle
item.description: Emily, from Palm Beach, Florida, was lost for words after she decided to trick her father and asked him to pull a $5 bill from underneath a sanitizer bottle without touching or knocking it down.

item.title: Ex-triathlete, 26, says her 42I breasts have made her spine collapse and put her in a wheelchair
item.description: Debbie Horton, 26, from Nuneaton in Warks., had several operations to fix multiple spinal problems - but said the NHS refused to fund a breast reduction surgery to solve the source of the issue.

item.title: Spanish Princess Leonor is driven to school by King Felipe for her first day back
item.description: Spanish Princess Leonor, 14, waved to cameras as King Felipe, 52, drove her to school for the first day of term in Madrid amid the Covid-19 crisis. The royal donned a face mask and was temperature checked.

item.title: Close-up image of a Romanesco cauliflower is the largest photograph ever taken at 3,200 megapixelsÂ
item.description: The images, taken at a US Department of Energy laboratory in California, include the head of a Romanesco, a vegetable closely related to broccoli, and a 19th century wood engraving.

item.title: Catch! Riley the 85lb Golden Retriever leaps into his owner's arms for a cuddle in adorable trickÂ
item.description: Six-year-old golden retriever Riley, from Richmond, Virginia, runs at owner Nick Kime at speed before launching himself up into Nick's arms in an adorable trick.

item.title: Nigella Lawson apologises to 'non-gendered' campaigner over column she wrote 27 years ago
item.description: Campaigner for non-gendered people, Christie Elan-Cane, has spent 27 years seeking an apology from Lawson, 60, after she wrote in a 1993 column that surgery to change gender was 'self-mutilation'

item.title: 'Posh lads' at Durham University 'planned competition to have sex with poorest girl on campus'Â
item.description: Durham University has launched an investigation and has vowed to kick out offending students, saying the 'unacceptable' chat 'violated the values and behaviours that we uphold as a university community'.

item.title: Stomach-churning footage shows audiologist removing 16 YEARS worth of wax from patient's ear
item.description: GRAPHIC CONTENT: Neel Raithatha was visited by a man suffering severe ear pain. Footage shows the audiologist, based in Leicestershire, removing wax from one of his ears, footage shows.
item.media:credit: Mr Neel Raithatha / The Hear Clinic & Clearwax / CATERS NEWS

item.title: Jay Shetty reveals how to think like a monk
item.description: Inspirational speaker Jay Shetty, 33, of London, has revealed on Good Morning Britain the lessons he learned while living as aÂ monk to improve your everyday life including finding daily rituals.

item.title: Plumber 'stabs customer to death and wounds her mother and neighbour after she asked for discount'Â
item.description: The 43-year-old man, whose name has not been disclosed, is said to have stabbed paramedic Inna Murzaeva, 32, to death before badly injuring her mother and neighbour in Kazakhstan.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Sir Roy Strong retreats from his love garden after fall in paradiseÂ
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: When he 'retired' from his role at Westminster Abbey last year, Sir Roy Strong looked forward to spending more time at his beloved jewel-box house...

item.title: Harry and Meghan lay out list of demands for virtual event organisers
item.description: The leaked four-page 'Virtual Event Request Form' from the Harry Walker Agency details the lengths event organisers must go to to book Harry and Meghan for an online audience.

item.title: Bugatti from 1934 once owned by King Leopold III of Belgium is sold for Â£9,535,000 at an auctionÂ
item.description: A Bugatti car from 1934 that was once owned by King Leopold III of Belgium has fetched Â£9,535,000 at an auction by Gooding and Company in London.

item.title: Climate change: Antarctic seabed channels carrying warm water could be aiding ice loss, study shows
item.description: Teams of researchers from the UK and the US studied Antarctica's Thwaites glacier and its adjoining ice shelves in early 2019 - one from the air, the other from an icebreaker vessel.

item.title: Been a victim of fraud? Here's our guide to getting your money back
item.description: We routinely hear from desperate fraud victims who have been denied a refund. Here, we explain all the tips and tricks we have learned that will help you fight your corner.

item.title: Royal Mail could stop delivering Saturday letters
item.description: The UK postal service has faced resistance over plans to deliver fewer letters and refocus its energy on its parcel delivery service - which has boomed during lockdown.

item.title: Myanmar soldiers say they were told to 'shoot all that you see' as they 'wiped out' Rohingya Muslims
item.description: The confessions are thought to beÂ are the first made by soldiers directly involved in the genocide which the Myanmar government claimed was a 'clearance campaign' to remove terrorists.

item.title: ASK TONY: I was hit with a Â£900 bill from E.ON's not-so smart meter
item.description: I changed to energy supplier E.ON in August 2019 and took up its offer of a smart meter. I think it installed the dumbest one they had in stock. From the word go, the 'in house display' has not worked.

item.title: Martin Lewis reveals his wife was robbed in 'terrifying' motorbike snatch and grab theftÂ
item.description: Money saving expert Martin Lewis, 48, from London, revealed on Twitter that his wife Lara Lewington, 40, was robbed in 'terrifying' motorbike snatch and grab theft earlier this week.

item.title: Tricky emoji quiz challenges YOU to name 20 of the most popular songsÂ on TikTok
item.description: UK-based Buzz Bingo is putting the internet's knowledge of well-known songs to the test with a tricky emoji quiz. The 20-question challenge features the most popular tunes used on TikTok.

item.title: What does Mars Retrograde mean for YOUR star sign?
item.description: A celebrity astrologer has revealed how members of the zodiac will react to the next few months of Mars Retrograde, which is known for disrupting our energy levels.

item.title: Boyfriend trying to impress his vegan girlfriend with a meat-free meal leaves secret order message
item.description: A Gold Coast chef shared a photo to Reddit on Tuesday of a note accompanying an order in the store's computer system,

item.title: Mums reveal how to remove nail polish from carpet and leave it looking brand new
item.description: A group of Australian mums have revealed how to remove nail polish from carpet after a woman was desperately seeking advice. Rather than vinegar, a popular suggestion was Windex.

item.title: Disgusting video proves why you should be washing car seats and dark upholstery MUCH more often
item.description: The clip shows aÂ woman rubbing the backseat of her car with a carpet cleaner. While the upholstery is not visibly stained, the machine quickly fills with murky brown water.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... Harry & Meghan's futureÂ
item.description: 'You've repaid the British taxpayer, you're financially independent at last. I'll cut to the chase: I wanna see if Archie can tap dance'

item.title: Epic moment 20 crocodiles fight over a dead cow in the Northern TerritoryÂ
item.description: Michele Bain watched the scene unfold from her houseboat in the crocodile-infested waters of Corroboree Billabong, south-east of Darwin, with her husband Mark on September 2.

item.title: PICTURED: Real estate agent surfer, 46, mauled to death by great white shark at a Gold Coast beach
item.description: Longboard rider Nick Slater was just metres away from other surfers atÂ Greenmount Beach when he was bitten on the leg at about 5pm.

item.title: Shocking moment doctor and domestic worker are pummeled by neighbors who refused to turn down music
item.description: Colombian authorities are expected to charge four individuals, including two tenants, after a surveillance video showed Dr. Dalila PeÃ±aranda and her employee being attacked last Friday.

item.title: Man, 56, has feet that look like lobster claws thanks to rare condition
item.description: Glen Stephens, 56, from Easley, South Carolina, virtually consults with podiatrist Dr. Brad Schaeffer on Thursday's premiere ofÂ My Feet Are Killing Me: First Steps.

item.title: Coronavirus: UK sees 'first credible' cases of REINFECTED people
item.description: Matt Hancock told the Health and Social Care Committee that the first 'credible' cases of coronavirus reinfection in Britain were starting to be seen.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Bolton pubs ordered BACK into lockdown
item.description: Boris Johnson and Matt Hancock joined medical experts in delivering a desperate appeal for 20 and 30-somethings to rein in their behaviour, amid growing alarm over a surge in cases.

item.title: Britain reports 30 more deaths from Covid-19 in biggest spike for six weeks
item.description: The Department of Health announced the significant hike in deaths but said it did not include Northern Ireland which is yet to report its figures.
